title: Darius has a 96% ban rate and pick rate (combined according to lolking)
body: How can anyone (including riot) not see that he needs to be nerfed?

It's hard to please everyone in cases like this.

Remove his heal and he becomes balanced. It's that simple. His Q heal has literally no business being in his kit. It makes no sense thematically (he's all about "MAKE NO MISTAKES" and healing = admitting a mistake, among other things). It also makes no sense as a reward-based system. Your reward for hitting your Q properly is bleed stacks and noticeably increased and satisfying amounts of damage. Why heal? Why scale on missing health? He's already going to out-trade you due to the nature of {{champion:122}} so what's the point of ALSO healing him? In general attacks that deal damage AND ALSO heal are bad design in general. It's even worse when it's ham-fisted in a kit that doesn't need it and makes no sense.

If you can't get him to be a viable and balanced champion without that heal then something fundamental has to change about his kit, and you're doing it wrong.

I think it's safe to say that nobody is pleased with Darius at the moment, and Riot should take notice.

The people who love playing him, or believe him to not be powerful anymore, cannot seem to get past draft pick without him in the banned section. This high ban rate indicates that nobody likes playing against him. The problem isn't with the community, it's with the balance team.

I don't think being so light on the fixes is helping him all that much when he can't be played in draft mode. I actually don't believe he's a noob stomper, and I don't believe he's easy to play. That's more Garen's scene. I've actually seen Darius players lose in ranked before because they didn't play well, they didn't die as much as most who lose badly, but their impact on the game was minimal at best. However his benefit for being successful is still too high, and he is still very oppressive in my opinion. In normal mode, which I play frequently, people let out a complaint each time they have to lane against him. I can see why the majority of players are keeping him banned. The community is rejecting Darius.

Am I the only person who doesn't think it's as much of a numbers problem with Darius as it is in his kit? Look, his kit is most certainly thematically cohesive; if he grabs you, you're pretty much dead. He's supposed to be a slow, big-ass guy who, once he gets a hold on you, is most likely going to kill you. That makes perfect sense. The problem with this champion is how toxic his kit is to play against. Think of someone like Yasuo. Is hit kit thematically cohesive? I would definitely say so; he's actually one of my favorite champions thematic-wise in the game. But is he fair to fight against? Most people seem to disagree with me, but I honestly don't think he is whatsoever. This is the same thing I have with Darius. It feels like his kit is just... too much, for lack of a better way to say it. It's got quite a bit of stuff going on in it, and considering the fact that his laning phase is horrendously annoying to deal with, I honestly just don't like this whole champions kit as a whole when it comes to gameplay. I mean, I already hate any sort of champion who is designed around being good at one phase of the game, and SUCKING at another; it's okay to have strengths and weaknesses, but it's like... Darius goes too far in each direction. He's way too strong in laning phase versus melee champions, and way too vulnerable and weak late game. I don't know how I would change it, so I guess I don't have a right to complain, but in general I would say he needs an actual rework myself.
